Grouped_Utterances: I've been doing pretty well, actually. Just trying to keep up with everything. Not really. I’ve been trying to focus more on the positive aspects of interactions. I think it’s helping. Yeah, I think I’m feeling lighter. I try to let go of things that don’t serve me or that I can’t control. Sometimes I feel like I don’t have enough time, or I forget to make it a priority. It’s been a bit challenging, but I’ve been more mindful about protecting my skin when I’m outdoors. I’ve been more aware of how I react to situations. I think I’m getting better at taking a step back before responding. Yes, I think I’m more open with my friends about how I feel instead of bottling things up.

Not really traveling, but I did meet up with some friends I hadn’t seen in a while. We went to this amazing Moroccan restaurant. It felt really good. We laughed a lot and reminisced about old times. It reminded me of how important those connections are. I think it’s a mix. I try to initiate plans, but sometimes life gets busy. I’m glad they reached out this time. I had a deep talk with my sister about our childhood. It felt good to share our experiences and validate each other. I feel closer to her now. It was nice to hear her perspective and realize we went through similar struggles.

I try to meditate when I can. It helps clear my mind and ground me. I really like guided meditations. They help me focus and keep my mind from wandering. I’ve used Headspace and Insight Timer. They both have some great options. I try to exercise regularly, and I’ve been practicing yoga, which helps a lot.

I’ve been doing it a few times a week, but I’d like to make it a daily habit. Yes, I think that would help me stick to it. Maybe in the morning before starting my day. Those are both excellent choices! Perhaps you could explore a few new meditations that focus on letting go or gratitude to support your new mindset. That’s a good idea. I’ll look into that. I’ve been going to a class once a week, but I’d like to do some home practice too. I think I could do that. Maybe a short session a few times a week. I’d like to delve deeper into how I can manage stress better and maybe explore more mindfulness techniques.
